list_definition.definition: a round flat cap made of soft cloth, as worn by soldiers

list_ex_of_english: I think we mentioned a red or black beret, but the possibilities are endless.
To mark their commitment and esprit de corps they wear a uniform and a red beret.
We may call them schoolchildren, but they are not necessarily what one thinks of as nice little things going around in long socks and berets.
Some of them merely wore a beret, pair of shorts and sandals.
The wearer of the beret came up and talked to me, but he was very cagey, giving "yes"and"no" answers.
At the last count, the thin blue lines of the blue berets were peacekeeping in 17 countries with 71,000 peacekeepers.
Men who have proudly worn the red beret for many years are now being denied that privilege.
In these cases green berets will be provided so far as they are available.
